verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Unclean and battered, torn by sin, By things I do, my thoughts within, I lie there bloodied on life's road with death and sin my only load.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Across that road the world passed by turning a deaf ear to my cry, No help to give, they could not save and so they left me for my grave.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: And, what of me, when I saw need? Did I my Savior's bidding heed? Too often on the other side I've walked away because of pride.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Sin bleeds from me and stops my breath, in Adam all I know is death; My works are rags, my offerings vain, From dust I came in dust remain.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: But in my need my Savior died, Not passing on the other side. Rebreathed His Spirit in my dust, bound up my wounds, declared me just.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Now safe within His Church I'm free; Blood, Water, Spirit plead for me,
The Ark of God, the Inn of Grace Where I behold my Father's face.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
May I in Christ my neighbor know Binding his wounds serves Christ below.
Your love for him make plain through me, that he may, too, your Glory see.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines:
You loved me when I could not love, For my sin barred me from above.
In Christ my love is now set free, O praise and bless the Trinity.
